intro: Centrosis abortiva, commonly known as the abortive centrosis, is a rare and poorly understood plant species. It is characterized by its unique floral structure, which exhibits a distinctive centroradial arrangement of stamens and carpels. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in temperate regions. Its reproductive cycle is complex, involving a prolonged flowering period and specific pollination mechanisms. Due to its limited distribution and fragile habitat, Centrosis abortiva is considered a conservation concern.
